title: Add help modal with keyboard shortcuts
description:
# Add Help Modal with Keyboard Shortcuts

## User Story
**As a** Consoul user
**I want** to view all available keyboard shortcuts and help information
**So that** I can learn to use the TUI efficiently

## Description

Create a help modal accessible from the ContextualTopBar (SOUL-55) help button. The modal should display all keyboard bindings grouped by category, current configuration information, and links to documentation.

## Context

The ContextualTopBar (SOUL-55) will provide a help button/icon (typically ? or F1). This ticket implements the help modal that appears when the help button is triggered.

Similar to other TUI help screens, this should provide a well-organized reference of all available commands and shortcuts.

## Technical Notes

**File to Create:**
- src/consoul/tui/widgets/help_modal.py

**Integration:**
- Listen for ContextualTopBar.HelpRequested message or F1 key binding
- Push help modal using app.push_screen()
- Display keyboard shortcuts grouped by category
- Show current theme, profile, model
- Provide links to online documentation

**Content Categories:**
- Navigation (conversation switching, scrolling)
- Actions (new conversation, model selection, search)
- Input (message editing, sending)
- System (help, settings, quit)

## Acceptance Criteria

**Given** I click the help button in ContextualTopBar
**When** the help modal opens
**Then** I see all keyboard shortcuts organized by category

**Given** I press F1
**When** the key is pressed
**Then** the help modal opens

**Given** the help modal is open
**When** I view the content
**Then** I see current theme, profile, and model information

**Given** I'm viewing the help modal
**When** I press Esc or click close
**Then** the modal closes and returns to the main screen

## Dependencies

**Prerequisites:**
- SOUL-55 (ContextualTopBar must exist with help button)
